title: libert19
author: libert19
content: Observed lately that not many crypto projects announce themselves on bitcointalk these days. Currently successful projects like Ethereum, MANA, AAVE (back then ETHLEND), NEM have anns here, but as years passed we see projects stopped bothering with bitcointalk. What do you think is the reason? Has bitcointalk lost it's charm?

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on November 29, 2023, 07:37:57 AMObserved lately that not many crypto projects announce themselves on bitcointalk these days. Currently successful projects like Ethereum, MANA, AAVE (back then ETHLEND), NEM have anns here, but as years passed we see projects stopped bothering with bitcointalk. What do you think is the reason? Has bitcointalk lost it's charm? What charm exactly mate?  Are you forgetting there's an altcoins session on the forum. If you check properly, you will find so many new project creating Ann threads over there. The reason might just be simply because there There are so many failed crypto projects over the years and there aren't any more trusted altcoins projects available. Because of this, more people are beginning to adopt Bitcoin instead, which I think is good news.

comments.author: EL MOHA
comments.body: One reason I can get is the fact that these projects actually found out that the Bitcointalk forum just as the name implies has shifted its focus totally to bitcoin only related issues and the alternative cryptocurrencies are not getting the attention they deserve. And for a wide coverage of their project they go to maybe other forum to advertise their projects and works. I don’t see this as Bitcointalk losing it charm but rather it’s members putting their focus fully into bitcoin only. There is this dashboard that shows the number of daily registered members (I can’t find it yet) and it is still increasing which shows that this forum still has its charm

comments.author: DVlog
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on November 29, 2023, 07:37:57 AMObserved lately that not many crypto projects announce themselves on bitcointalk these days. Currently successful projects like Ethereum, MANA, AAVE (back then ETHLEND), NEM have anns here, but as years passed we see projects stopped bothering with bitcointalk. What do you think is the reason? Has bitcointalk lost it's charm? There are projects that made announcements in the forum but the market is bearish and those new projects haven't gotten much hype in the market which is why you are seeing them this way. Another possible explanation is that there are so many marketing options available right now that new project don't want to spend their time designing an announcement thread for their project. Whichever case there is bitcointalk is not only an announcement thread for a new project. There are other useful aspects of this forum that should not be overshadowed.

comments.author: Richbased
comments.body: Bitcointalk is more focused on bitcoin related activities so any other cryptocurrency will find there way in the altcoin discussion session. we should understand that the major objective of this forum is centered towards creating an acceptable awareness among bitcoiners and if you check very well you'll observe that most discussion here is Bitcoin related. Every member focusing on bitcoin is as a result of it's improvement and huge success it has recorded over the years as everyone interest is towards a coin that's dominating the coin market.

comments.author: shahzadafzal
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on November 29, 2023, 07:37:57 AMObserved lately that not many crypto projects announce themselves on bitcointalk these days. Currently successful projects like Ethereum, MANA, AAVE (back then ETHLEND), NEM have anns here, but as years passed we see projects stopped bothering with bitcointalk. What do you think is the reason? Has bitcointalk lost it's charm? Transparency!!!Transparency plays a pivotal role in the evolving dynamics of crypto project announcements. On Bitcointalk, the scrutiny is intense; a single comment from an established member can swiftly expose any discrepancies, potentially derailing a project’s launch. Bitcointalk still has a big matured audience and the stakes for transparency have risen.In the current landscape, a significant portion of new crypto projects falls into the trap of being perceived as scams. This is largely because many fail to articulate clear goals and transparent token distribution strategies to their users. Bitcointalk community members are increasingly demanding a higher standard of information, and platforms that can meet these expectations effectively become the preferred choice.While Bitcointalk has historical significance, but yes the charm of Bitcointalk for new crypto project announcements has diminished.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: Bitcointalk not lost it's charm, Altcoins board is.If many projects/bounties aren't scam and users who post in Altcoins board isn't a bot or shitposter, we will see a similar quality like the project that has a campaign pay with Bitcoin.So it means promoting in Altcoins board isn't really work anymore, they mostly trying to get listed in top exchange or launchpad.I won't say they're successful, but it's just an another exit scam coin.

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: Being attractive to a group of projects that more than not turn out to be scams is not a charm. I do not think many here will miss them if there was a significant drop in altcoin projects but I do not think there has been.The forum is still swarmed with bounty spammers which is a direct result of new projects looking for publicity. The altcoin section too still has lots of ANN threads popping up now and again.If there has been any drop it will be due to an overall drop in new projects compared to the ICO surge during the last 2 bullruns.- Jay -

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: These projects have become duplicates and most of them are tokens that only offer promises of quick profits and are not altcoin on a different blockchain, there is not much to discuss here compare the ease of having investors on X.The forum is open  and responses are recorded not like some other places where it is easy to spam or use bots.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on November 29, 2023, 07:37:57 AMObserved lately that not many crypto projects announce themselves on bitcointalk these days. Currently successful projects like Ethereum, MANA, AAVE (back then ETHLEND), NEM have anns here, but as years passed we see projects stopped bothering with bitcointalk. If these are the projects you mention, then there is no harm to the forum, considering the reputation of most of these "crypto projects" which mostly only contribute to the fact that the average person gets a very distorted image of Bitcoin. In fact, the less they are promoted here, the better for the forum's reputation and even better for all those desperate people who serve as cheap (or even free) labor in their bounty campaigns.Quote from: libert19 on November 29, 2023, 07:37:57 AMWhat do you think is the reason? Has bitcointalk lost it's charm? If you have a legitimate project that you want to advertise and promote, then this is definitely not the case. However, I think that forums as such are increasingly losing their charm, considering that new generations want something else like FB, Telegram and similar things. But in the end, as I already said, it is not a bad thing for the forum.

comments.body: Because the project prefers other avenues to promote it, including on social media which is where the public is there, in addition now some major media have offered services where they can advertise projects by being published through articles so maybe that's what bothers them not coming to bitcointalk anymore for other reasons maybe there can be called the attractiveness of altcoins is decreasing.Yes maybe the altcoin projects that come are decreasing because there are many spammers and scams there while for others the attractiveness of bitcointalk is getting higher, for example many new casinos come to bitcointalk with signature campaign promotions in the end they can survive and thrive here, even some casinos have partnered successfully with big football clubs.

comments.author: Text
comments.body: For me, the appeal of the Bitcointalk forum didn't diminish; it just reduced the prevalence of scammers. Many platforms and channels have emerged for project announcements, such as on social media. They prefer to promote their projects there because they know there are many potential victims. We know that most emerging crypto projects are not beneficial, as their sole purpose is to take investors' money. They avoid announcing on Bitcointalk because they know that veterans and experts in evaluating crypto projects are present here.

comments.author: goldkingcoiner
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on November 29, 2023, 07:37:57 AMObserved lately that not many crypto projects announce themselves on bitcointalk these days. Currently successful projects like Ethereum, MANA, AAVE (back then ETHLEND), NEM have anns here, but as years passed we see projects stopped bothering with bitcointalk. What do you think is the reason? Has bitcointalk lost it's charm? Too many shitcoin and scam projects has made altcoins lose its appeal on Bitcointalk. There are two theories:1. There have been too many disappointments and scams when it comes to new altcoin projects. Even if the altcoin project is really interesting with an awesome team, people on Bitcointalk will no longer want to risk their time/money.2. Most projects are not good enough to pass our community scrutiny. Thats why they are not going to expose themselves here on Bitcointalk in the first place. Social Media is more blurry in that regard. As long as something is trending, people will believe it is good.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on November 29, 2023, 07:37:57 AMWhat do you think is the reason? Has bitcointalk lost it's charm? First of all, bitcointalk community is more vigilant when it comes to altcoin projects, meaning scambusters will check almost all new projects and if there are some red flags (and in many cases there are), altcoin reputation will immediately go down the toilet.2nd reason is that in the past those altcoin projects simply didn't have any other platforms to promote crypto, so where else to go other than bitcointalk. Situation changed now and there is plenty of competition that wasn't popular ~10 years ago.3rd reason is that bitcointalk community is generally not altcoin friendly and focused more on bitcoin, meaning its a waste of time and money to promote altcoins here and it still baffles me how bounty managers still manage to sell campaigns to their clients.Last but not the least, forums are not as popular as they used to be 10 years ago (I would say that golden age of forums was 15+ years ago when fewer people had access to internet meaning more quality discussions) so its only natural that bitcointalk is not as popular as it used to be,
